comment: @RyanMarino Ive noticed recently patients being prescribed both Tamiflu and z-paks on the same script.
@RyanMarino Im going to caveat this:  the evidence is better in kids.  https://t.co/N0CI1ynqdN
@zmeowel Why arent pharmacists calling the police on those scripts

@RyanMarino Despite vax, I had flu last month. On my first really bad night I started tamiflu.  Worst symptoms did resolve in about 3.5 days. In retrospect I may have experienced some psych side effects that I thought were from the virus. But Id do it ag
BMJ has been covering this for years and actually spurred the Cochrane Review with their coverage of this drug with minimal benefit and high earnings potential: https://t.co/xSXRfsQVa7

Cochrane did a nice commentary on this with links to citations (I recommend the actual Cochrane Reviews) that I could never top so read here (takeaways-no reduced risk of flu complications or hospitalizations, high side effect rate, Rx is very expensive!): https://t.co/3nMjwBTwnb

@domsisti I had flu this yr as well despite getting the shot, but symptoms only lasted ~3.5 days (likely bc of the shot!). I took Tamiflu when I had H1N1 back in 2009(?) & I vomited nonstop until I discontinued it. Not that those anecdotes prove much
@RyanMarino wait, what...what is this conspiracy from a doctor I follow... https://t.co/7IviMcagmI

@atomicmo11y BMJ has covered this controversy*https://t.co/osiOnHDw1e*controversy is only regarding financial conflicts of interest, the evidence on oseltamivir has been reproduced and reviewed at length

@md_wallach Theres also some (very limited) evidence NIs might help sicker people in general (elderly, kids, critically ill), but no evidence that complications of flu or hospitalizations are reduced in any population. But those outpatient Rx dollars mak
@RyanMarino I try to convince people not to take it. I do find it interesting the people who refuse the flu shot because eww & belly up to the tamiflu bar without a second thought.
@RyanMarino Whoa. Quite the accusation that Roche is paying CDC.  What evidence do you have to support that statement?  I own no Pharma stock and have no dog in this fight.
@GrumpyXian But what if the medicine only gave you 6 hours less symptoms and guaranteed you vomited and maybe even caused psychosis? Plus it cost $100+
